episodes.title: The Hollywood Cult That Channeled Rudolph Valentino
episodes.description:
In the summer of 1935 a Hollywood "cult" that claimed they were channeling the spirit of Rudolph Valentino were arrested on suspicion of fraud. According to one of the men arrested, Valentino was communicating with an actress named Marchen Jorgensen via a haunted typewriter in a house nestled high in the Hollywood Hills. 

SOURCES:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IpShEAUSeW1mafo5L2g2wDtw3h5gcEarlG3ch5GstCw/edit?usp=sharing

Thank you to Tanner F. Boyle, Connor S, Erica Lukes, Martin Cannon, The Colonel and Jessica Knapik for lending your voices for this project!

https://www.patreon.com/weirdreadsemilylouise 

Follow me on Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/weirdreadsemilylouise

episodes.title: The Pentecostal Cult That Murdered Their Mother (Documentary)
episodes.description:
In February 1933 John Hampton Mills murdered his 72 year old mother Lucinda during a week long religious revival. He was the head of a Pentecostal sect that became known as the "Cult of the Unknown Tongues". What led him and his family to commit such a heinous act?

This documentary covers the Lucinda Mills murder case in detail and also contains an interview with Harry H. Reed, the author of the book Tongues of Deception which you can buy on Amazon:
https://amzn.eu/d/hsiFyPj

Thank you again to Harry for taking the time to speak with me and also for sharing his research/court records with me. Please go support his book!

SOURCES:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1B4t3zssHegqIhbtbAmhutwQhjNsO8oaVCWKuFUK8XlE/edit?usp=sharing

Support the channel on Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/weirdreadsemilylouise 

Follow me on Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/weirdreadsemilylouise/

episodes.title: The Abduction of Judy Doraty (Documentary)
episodes.description:
On May 23rd, 1973 Judy Doraty and her family were travelling home from a bingo game in Texas when they saw a strange light in the sky on a lonely patch of highway. What came next would change the course of Judy's life forever. Through a series of hypnotic regressions she began to recall being aboard an alien spaceship and her testimony would provide one of the first links between alien abductions and cattle mutilations. Her story would go on to become the blueprint for another bizarre abduction case that kickstarted the Dulce base conspiracy -- but was any of it real?

This documentary is a skeptical exploration of the people involved in Judy's story -- from Linda Moulton Howe to Dr Leo Sprinkle --  and how they shaped and influenced it. It also explores hypnotic regression therapy, false memories and how our minds can be manipulated by even the most well meaning of people.

WATCH THE FIRST TWO VIDEOS IN THIS SERIES:

The Secret History of Dulce: https://youtu.be/AlhcmqevfXA?si=i15bFqB1cOpuDfCW

episodes.title: The "Love Cult" Murder of Minnie Dilley
episodes.description:
On Saturday 4th April 1931, the body of 73 year old Minnie Dilley was found in her home in Forty Fort, Pennsylvania. It was a brutal and senseless murder, one that shook the local community and had the police desperately searching for answers. A shocking arrest soon led to tabloid tales of a supposed “witchcraft murder mystery” and plans for a "love cult" that had led to homicide. These were salacious headlines that sold newspapers and kept readers gripped, but the story behind the headlines was far more real and much more disturbing. 

Join my Patreon to get early access to videos, our Discord server and exclusive video/audio content!
https://www.patreon.com/weirdreadsemilylouise

Thanks to Tanner F. Boyle at Getting Spooked for lending me his voice: 
https://tannerfboyle.substack.com/

episodes.title: The Cult Leader Who Said He'd Never Die (Documentary)
episodes.description:
In 1938 Dr Louis Conde found himself at the center of a scandal — he stood accused of operating a confidence game after promising his followers financial abundance, intellect, perfect health and the life of their dreams, as well as assuring them that he’d never die. 

Unsurprisingly none of his assurances manifested despite the thousands of dollars that they’d given him. As it turned out, underneath his spiritually enlightened veneer stood a man accused of being a cult leader, a predator, an alcoholic, a liar. The allegations made headline news and soon people across the United States were reading about the strange metaphysical teachings of a man that called himself Lahissa, the New Teacher. 

I first heard about this cult via an article by Beardy History:
https://beardyhistory.com/2023/08/07/crazy-cults-of-the-1920s-and-1930s/

You can find all of my sources here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SWZTdmcbPi6BWubVNLJaYZLzay7IReqEdmnseQcxQVc/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: The Bizarre Cult of Brother Carson and the Solar Temple
episodes.description:
This is the story of the Bizarre Cult of Brother Carson and the Solar Temple. On October 12th, 1935, The Vancouver Sun in Canada ran a front page article that would’ve immediately captured the attention of just about anyone passing by. It read, ‘Husband Seeks Ban On Cult’ and the contents were bizarre and salacious — there were allegations of theft, hypnosis, mysterious telephone calls and even a kidnapping. Little was known about this strange Vancouver sect or the man that led them. Who were they and did they really hypnotize a woman, ultimately kidnapping her?

You can support the channel by joining my Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/weirdreadsemilylouise

episodes.title: Cranks, Christ and Cults with Fundie Fridays | Weird Reads with Emily Louise LIVE
episodes.description:
Thank God for Fundie Fridays! Tonight’s guests are Reverend Jen and King James, a married couple who just so happen to be my favourite YouTube creators. Their hilarious and well researched deep dives into Christian fundamentalism and conservative politics are not only incredibly entertaining, but are also helping people to deconstruct harmful belief systems and ultimately improve their lives. From The Duggars and Abby Shapiro to Amy Carlson and George Santos — they seek to make big, important topics easier to deal with for their audience with thorough analysis, compassionate insight and rowdy humor.

We'll be talking about conservative cranks, Christian fundamentalism, cults and so much more!

episodes.title: The Cult That Manifested A Baby
episodes.description:
In July 1938 a startling announcement rocked the city of Richmond, Virginia — the twin ray of Jesus Christ had been received in the form of a two month old baby, and it was here to usher in a new Golden Age. The three people at the center of the claim were devout disciples of Guy and Edna Ballard’s I AM Activity — a bizarre proto-new age movement that had stirred controversy and accusations of being a cult throughout the 1930s. Their claim of precipitating, or manifesting the twin ray, culminated in a disturbing all-night ritual, charges of insanity, a mysterious abduction, a court case, and an even deeper, more earthly mystery at the heart of it all. 

You can support my work on Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/weirdreadsemilylouise

You can watch my original video on the Cult of I AM here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jsKt4edO98w

episodes.title: The Self Help Cult That Tried To Raise an IMMORTAL BABY : The Master Metaphysicians
episodes.description:
Use code EMILYLOUISE16 for up to 16 FREE MEALS + 3 Surprise Gifts across 6 HelloFresh boxes plus free shipping at https://bit.ly/3QInkAM

James B. Schafer and his Royal Fraternity of Master Metaphysicians are definitely one of the strangest and least well known self help cults to be born out of the economic depression of the 1930's. They hit the headlines when they claimed to be raising a baby named Jean to be immortal -- she was to be reared on a diet of vegetarianism and positive thinking. She would be Miss Immortality, designed to live forever! But did you know that their experiment in immortality was actually inspired by none other than author of Think and Grow Rich, Napoleon Hill?

Join me as we dive deep into yet another strange cult tale from the early 20th century!

Special thanks to Triskaidekapho13ic for helping source archive materials & creating an actual sources document for me.

episodes.title: The Cult of I AM : The WILD Story of Guy & Edna Ballard's New Age Religious Movement
episodes.description:
CW : Anti-s*mitism, f*cism…and me ranting about capitalism (again).

The new age world is murky, filled with ascended masters, violet flames and people talking about their "I AM presence" - but where did all of that come from? 

In the 1930's, Guy & Edna Ballard started their cult of I AM - a new age religious movement and offshoot of Helena Blavatsky's theosophical teachings, and the work of neo-theosophists like Alice Bailey and C.W Leadbeater. They were guided by the ascended masters - a group of spiritual advisors that Guy, Edna and their son Donald claimed to have direct contact with, including Jesus and St Germain.

But behind the brightly coloured charts and strangely aesthetically appealing artwork, lies a more sinister story, connecting this world of new age woo-woo directly to f*scists and right-wing ideology that's still very much present to this day.

Enjoyed the video? You can support me directly via Ko-Fi☕ 
https://bit.ly/3ugO5AN 

Special thanks to Triskaidekapho13ic for helping source archive materials & creating an amazing sources document for me...

episodes.title: The Cult of the Great Eleven : May Otis Blackburn's DEADLY Divine Order
episodes.description:
There have been so many disturbing cults throughout history, but May Otis Blackburn’s Divine Order of the Royal Arms of the Great Eleven has to be one of the weirdest…and obscure.

May and her daughter Ruth were trying to make it in Hollywood, but instead they were visited by Archangel Gabriel, who told them that they were the two witnesses from the Book of Revelations. But the story doesn’t stop there, and it gets a whole lot stranger…

We covered this case on my podcast, Dial Femme for Murder, and we’re hoping to have Samuel Fort on soon to discuss his excellent book, The Cult of the Great Eleven which I highly recommend reading!

episodes.title: Edgar Cayce : Sleeping Prophet or FRAUD?
episodes.description:
Edgar Cayce is one of America's most famous so-called “psychics” of all time, and widely known as one of the architects of the modern New Age movement, as well as being the "sleeping prophet".

In this video, we trace the strange story of Edgar Cayce's life - from his origins in Hopkinsville, Kentucky, to his years tapping into “Source”, his time spent trying to cash in on the Texas oil boom and his later readings on everything from Atlantis to the origin of humanity. 

Was Edgar Cayce a fraud, or was he the real deal?

Honestly, I think he was a successful grifter that cashed in on the growing popularity of alternative medicine and trance healing, as well as new age ideas that had been popularized by Helena Blavatsky and other theosophists. 

Some of his ideas were incredibly harmful and discriminatory - but I’ll let you watch and form your own opinions! As always, sound off in the comments below. ALSO - did you notice I got a new camera? I hope so otherwise that was a waste of money lol.

episodes.title: Who was Helena Blavatsky? | The Grandmother of the New Age & Founder of Theosophy
episodes.description:
Helena Blavatsky was the founder of the Theosophical Society and widely known as the Grandmother of the New Age. In this video, I dive into her life - from her aristocratic upbringing, to her years of travelling around the world, to controversy, her teachings and her legacy.

This is the first part in a forthcoming series on the New Age and UFO cults. It’s important to understand Helena Blavatsky first, because she created so much of what we know as “new age”, and almost every group that we’ll be talking about takes something from her. I am so excited to share this new series with you all. I've been fascinated by new religious movements and cults for a long time, and I wanted to find a way to talk about them that doesn’t feel exploitative. I think it’s important to remember that inside all of these movements/cults is someone who has a family and people that love them, and often there are victims too.

I know this video was quite historical, so let me know what you think in the comments. Also what do you think of the new filming set up? It feels more…cosy? Idk. Sound off down below.

Also I feel like my explanation of "Aryan" was incredibly brief and over simplified and I'd urge you all to go and read this article. It didn't actually start with H*tler --
https://bit.ly/3GnVYtY

Please heed the TW at 42:50 - it gets bad!

episodes.title: Where is Shelly Miscavige? MISSING for over 15 years...
episodes.description:
Today we're going to be diving deep into the disappearance of Shelly Miscavige and the Church of Scientology to find out what really happened - is Shelly Miscavige missing, or is she a prisoner of belief?

I'm truly fascinated with cults & religions and Scientology has been one of my favourite religious organisations to look into for a while now. I think I've watched almost every documentary, from John Sweeney on the BBC, to Louis Theroux, Going Clear, Leah Remini's show and obviously the great journalism from Tony Ortega. I wanted to talk about Shelly Miscavige on here for a while because, from the outside, it seems like a terrifying mystery...the first lady of Scientology that went missing. However, when you dig into it, you find - in my opinion - an even more terrifying story of coercive control and years of religious indoctrination -- ALLEGEDLY.

Anyway, I hope you enjoy this video and I definitely have a lot more videos on cults & religious organisations coming up. Also, go listen to mine and Martyn's podcast -- we post every Tuesday and cover true crime, cults and conspiracies!
